titleStmt.title: I heard the earliest
a machine readable transcription

availability.p: The text of the original document is in the public domain. Subject to certain exceptions, public domain works may be freely copied or used in the creation of derivative works without permission, or authorization, of the former copyright owners.

The text encoding was created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and is governed by a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

note.p: Written in pencil on a small page from a notebook, on which is pasted a clipping from a newspaper about the funeral of Signor Brignoli and the reaction of Patti, pinned to an unmarked proof of "The Dead Tenor," thirty words: "I heard the earliest singing of Patti, (in 1860 if I remember right)â€”heard her many times, Brignoli sang with her at her first appearance in NY in 1859." The poem was first published in 1884.

bibl.author: Whitman, Walt
bibl.title: The Dead Tenor
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839-1919, Library of Congress, Washington, DC.

body.head: rignoli
body.p: —The funeral of place this morning house, and was attended people. The famous singer of very diff

I heard the earliest singing of Patti, (in 1860
if I remember right) — heard her
many times

Brignoli sang with her
as her first appearance in NY
in 1859
